definition[0]: a formal letter stating what someone intends to do. A letter of intent is not a promise or a contract, but does show a serious intention to do something
example[0]: The firm had signed a binding letter of intent (=one that counts in law as a formal agreement) to buy the chain of stores.
example[1]: They had only signed a non-binding letter of intent (=one that does not count in law as a formal agreement).
